  • Constructor Details

    • Hero

      public Hero(GameScene gameScene, KeyHandler keyHandler)
      Creates the Hero to be displayed in the GameScene. The Hero performs different actions based on the inputs registered by the KeyHandler.
      Parameters:
      gameScene - the gameScene where the Hero is displayed.
      keyHandler - the input handler for actions to be performed.
      See Also:
      • GameScene
      • KeyHandler

  • Method Details

    • isInteracting

      public boolean isInteracting()
      Returns:
      the Hero's interact property.
      • True: The hero is allowed to interact.
      • False: The hero is not allowed to interact.

    • setInteract

      public void setInteract(boolean interact)
      Modify the Hero's possibility to interact with other elements.
      Parameters:
      interact - value to apply to Hero's interact parameter.

    • getText

      public javafx.scene.text.Text getText()
      Returns:
      the reference of the collected number of coins field.

    • addScore

      public void addScore(int amount)
      Adds an amount of coins to the number of collected coins.
      Parameters:
      amount - coins to be added to the score.

    • getScore

      public int getScore()
      Returns:
      the number of collected coins.

    • getCoin

      public javafx.scene.image.ImageView getCoin()
      Returns:
      the coin ImageView used by the GUI.

    • getKey

      public javafx.scene.image.ImageView getKey()
      Returns:
      the key ImageView used by the GUI.

    • loadHeroInterface

      public void loadHeroInterface()
      Loads the Hero's GUI elements in memory. List of elements loaded :
      • Coin (Image displayed that refers to the actual number of coins)
      • Key (Image displayed that refers to the actual number of coins)
      • Score (Hero's number of collected coins)

    • loadHeroValues

      public void loadHeroValues()
      Assigns the main physics values to the Hero on the creation of this object. Tha values to be used are extracted form the XmlReader object. List of values loaded :
      • WorldX (Hero's starting X-axis coordinate)
      • WorldY (Hero's starting Y-axis coordinate)
      • Speed (Hero's movement speed on both X and Y axis)
      • Gravity (Hero's gravity applied on Y axis)
      See Also:
      • XmlReader

    • update

      public void update(double time)
      This method is called by the GameScene object to perform the Hero's updates. This method is sensitive to inputs registered in the KeyHandler to apply movement speed on both X and Y axes and to perform interactions with the other elements of the scene. Also, it checks if collisions were occurred since last call in order to allow the Hero's movement.
      Parameters:
      time - the elapsed time since update's last call.
      See Also:
      • CollisionChecker
      • KeyHandler
      • GameScene

    • render

      public void render(Camera camera)
      Renders the Hero's display based on the Camera parameter.
      Parameters:
      camera - the camera to use as a display reference.
      See Also:
      • Camera

    • setSpawnCoordinates

      public void setSpawnCoordinates(double x, double y)
      Is used to teleport the hero at a point defined by the X and Y parameters. The camera is also updated to display the Hero in the middle of the screen.
      Parameters:
      x - X-axis coordinate.
      y - Y-axis coordinate.
      See Also:
      • Camera

    • jump

      public void jump()
      This method makes the Hero jump if he is allowed to. Note that to perform this action, the Hero has to be on a platform (in other words, his state must be FLOOR). Each time this action is performed, the Hero's attitude changes to "Jump" (which updates his imageView) and a sound is played.
      See Also:
      • AnimatedSprite

    • setCollision

      public void setCollision(String side)
      Is called every time a collision is detected between the Hero's hit box and a platform object. We save the collided sides to perform the appropriate action.
      Parameters:
      side - the side on which the hero collides with a platform object.
      See Also:
      • Platform
      • CollisionChecker

    • resetCollisions

      public void resetCollisions()
      Is used at the beginning of the update method to clear the list of the collided sides.

    • playSound

      public void playSound(String filename)
      Is used to play a sound saved in the resources' directory that matches with the filename parameter. If none of the files match, a NullPointerException is thrown.
      Parameters:
      filename - sound's file name to be played.
      See Also:
      • AudioClip

    • getState

      public Hero.State getState()
      Returns the Hero's ActualState in the GameScene. This provides information on the actions that can be performed by the Hero.
      Returns:
      the Hero's actualState property value.
      See Also:
      • Hero.State
